title: A Kibbutz
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Israel - Social life and customs
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Community organization
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Israel - Social conditions

Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Jewish families
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Jewish families
description: Gives a brief history of the establishment of the kibbutz. Describes community organisation, and the changing role of women on the kibbutz. Shows the progress of a child through the system. Discussion ensues when two of the haberim wish to leave the kibbutz - problems and advantages are aired.
